text: Hi all, I am able to install the validator
I am trying to test a transaction using marketplace participant as shown in the page <https://intelledger.github.io/tutorial.html>

$./bin/mktclient --name mkt --keyfile validator/keys/mkt.wif --config /home/ubuntu/projects/sawtooth-core/extensions/mktplace/etc/mktclient.js


Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./bin/mktclient", line 23, in <module>
    main()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/mktmain/client_cli.py", line 1642, in main
    local_main(cfg)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/mktmain/client_cli.py", line 1418, in local_main
    state = mktplace_state.MarketPlaceState(url)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/mktplace/mktplace_state.py", line 99, in __init__
    self.fetch()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/mktplace/mktplace_state.py", line 167, in fetch
    blockid = blockids[0]
IndexError: list index out of range
Hi all, its working now. It was a problem with the validator startup, as there is a old block file which was not deleted
Hi; why would one get "no module named sawtooth_xo.xo_cli" when running the arcade tutorial?
environment variable PYTHONPATH is set to the latest sawtooth-core repo root directory in my environment
No, I am on master; I'll try again on 0-7 then
Sounds good, we are working on a new tutorial that would encompass our new architecture, but it isn't done yet.
Getting the same result on the 0-7 branch

Your PYTHONPATH should be set up like the one in sawooth-core/tools/guest-files/local-env.sh. That file makes assumptions about the path to sawtooth-core, which is true if you are running in our vagrant environment. If not modify for your own environment.
Got it; wasn't testing in vagrant -- thanks
